I believe that Eclipse creates the blue-arrow decorator when the test
start=
s running, and removes it when the test is done, in order to
indicate the c=
urrently-running test.  This behavior would seem to
indicate a test that so=
mehow starts but never finishes.

Is it possible there's an infinite loop? =
 Are you using the Assume class?

   David Saff

> Running some tests and=
 a clump of them have a blue arrow decorator rather than the usual green ch=

his class by itself as a JUnit test, it runs fine. =A0But notice that there=
 is a different decorator and there are no execution times, so I believe th=
ese tests simply did not run.
